result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan N Applings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due by 7/21/2018. Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 97 days, 4/19/2015 to 7/24/2015.  To be served in Wisconsin State prison system.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan N Applings

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant indicating the DNA surcharge is mandatory after 1/1/14.
Letter from defendant asking if he has to pay the DNA surcharge if he previously paid one.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 MONTHS, concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 97 days (04-19-2015 to 07-24-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 MONTHS 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due by 07-21-2018; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Nathan N Applings in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Nathan N Applings in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on July 24, 2015 @ 8:30am received and filed
Letter from defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Nathan N Applings not in court, defendant in custody, not produced. Attorney Louis Edward Epps appeared by phone. Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel request an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing, as defense counsel is in trial on another matter in another court. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Nathan N Applings not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript (9 pages) commencing May 5, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Nathan N Applings in court with attorney Catelin Firer for Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Nathan N Applings in custody.  Ronald Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Adam Robakowski-MPD Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #08CF2979 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nathan N Applings in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Nathan N Applings in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defense moved to dismiss the Complaint for lack of probable cause. Arguements heard. Court denies Defense motion. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
